intro: Echinocactus ottonis var. minor, commonly known as the miniature golden barrel cactus, is a compact, slow-growing cactus native to the arid regions of Mexico. It features a short, cylindrical stem with a dense covering of bright green, spiny areoles, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its green body. It is well adapted to full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to thrive. Due to its unique form and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container cultivation.
